intro: Jurinea prokhanovii var. giseldonica, commonly known as the Giseldonica bladderwort, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand extreme drought conditions. Its leaves are succulent and often covered in a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss. This variant is distinguished by its unique floral morphology and is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptations to harsh environments.
